data.title: Add support for diamond cell grids
data.body:
Part 4/5 of my series of isometric patches.  Adds support for diamond cell grids, and updates TS to use them.

![yaaaaaay](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/3347429/6d774142-f8e1-11e3-9cee-474f64d22afd.png)

data.title: Shields should be interesting! (Not the Iron Curtain Power)
Shield
Add an option to mute spectators
data.body:
Some people complain about it. A checkbox below Allow Spectators one?

data.title: D2K: System.InvalidOperationException: Can't find production queues
data.body:
Getting this crash, cause not known.
I have played several games to conclusion using the mod.

```
Hacky Dune 2000 Mod at Version release-20140608
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18033
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Can't find production queues.
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Render.WithProductionOverlay.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__11B(TraitPair`1 x)
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Any suggestion as to what might be causing this would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Create OpenRA IRC network based on 2+ servers
data.body: to replace backend side of current hidden global in-game chat

data.title: Fix D2K paratroopers.
data.body: #5634 combined with legacy cruft broke the carryall drops in D2K.

data.title: Cleaned up HackyAI MCV deployment
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5622.

data.title: Selecting units with a shortcut will play two "selectionsounds"
Added a new OpenRA.Lint check for invalid actor definitions
data.body: as proposed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5742#issuecomment-47417929.

data.title: Added repair bonus for multiple players
data.body:
This fixes up a few remaining points from #5666:
- Fixes the player palette not cycling.
- Fixes the 20,20,25,15,20 steps -> 20,20,20,20,20.
- Fixes a couple of remaining minor style nits.
- Split the ISqrt changes out into its own PR (#5767).

data.title: Add Exts.ISqrt to avoid fp sqrt calculations.
data.body:
This is based on the code from #5666, but extended/rewritten to cover all the cases we care about (not just CVec).

I spent some time trying to understand the algorithm, and now understand the key points, but I lose the plot when translating from decimal to binary. See http://www.embedded.com/electronics-blogs/programmer-s-toolbox/4219659/Integer-Square-Roots for some more details.

See http://pastebin.com/QGfk0be1 for a brute-force test-case for the entire int/uint range.

data.title: Make sprite frames read-only lists.
data.body:
Changes ISpriteSource.Frames to be of type IReadOnlyList<ISpriteFrame>.
- Updated implementations to return a ReadOnlyList around an array (to reduce wasted memory from exposing lists or lazy enumerators around lists).
- Protect non-public ISpriteFrame classes by making them inner classes to prevent casting.
- Added an AsReadOnly extension method for lists.

data.title: Tiberian Sun construction yard animation flickers
data.body:
![out](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3417229/823c2eee-fe36-11e3-8157-7c3b2087fd30.gif)

This can't be observed in the asset browser and can not be healed by defining offset values in the sequences YAML like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5764.

data.title: Fixed Tiberian Sun shroud offsets.
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5757 mentioned https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4718, but I don't really believe that the problem lies in the parser.

This is the original OS SHP Builder output of Tiberian Sun shroud.shp

![shpviewer 0000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3416674/4ff0e3f0-fe2f-11e3-9e0d-e59ddcf3811a.png)

This is our output from OpenRA.Utility.exe

![shroud-0000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3416684/5d64ff94-fe2f-11e3-884c-dfc31f763375.png)

Turns out the shapes match. Our parser seem to work correctly or just like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/20a6c75ba423a82ec030fdfe1e6f5fa4192fbee6 did before.

data.title: Make Shift+<Hotkey> queue five units/buildings. Fixes #5544.
data.body: I had a commit ready (as in, another one-liner :) that also made the CTRL key cancel builds, but that obviously conflicts with the CTRL+A and CTRL+T selection shortcuts. Let me know if you want that in anyhow, and if you have any preference how to fix the conflicts.

data.title: Fix fallout from tech-capture changes
data.body: The custom actor definitions on some missions slipped through the cracks in #5685

data.title: Add a new filter to server list which only shows servers where spectators are allowed
data.body:
I can't find a match to watch since most people turn off specs. This would make it easier.

data.title: Brought back damage per second evaluations (again)
data.body: This reverts the revert at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5720.

data.title: Added capturable tech to Red Alert
data.body: This completes where https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5685 started.

data.title: Generalize cell/world coordinate conversions.
data.body:
Part 3 / 5 of the isometric terrain implementation.
- CPos.CenterPosition has been replaced with Map.CenterOfCell.
- WPos.ToCPos has been replaced with Map.CellContaining.
- A bunch of plumbing changes so that a Map is available where it is needed.
- Cleaned up some more legacy code.

Moving the conversions into Map will allow these checks to be extended in future PRs to account for rectangular vs isometric cell grids, and use heightmap data.

data.title: Use TS shroud sprites.
data.body:
Part 2 / 5 of the isometric terrain implementation.  This generalizes our shroud rendering to support TS's quirks (shared palette, but two different sets of sprites).

The wavy lines are caused by a combination of #4718 and the isometric -> rectangular rendering.  The tiling is improved when rendered in the diamond grid (see [pchote:isometric](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/isometric)).

data.title: A new map to D2K
data.body: I think D2k need more maps. I added my map "The Far Lands".

data.title: PathingDomain does not care for destroyed bridges
data.body:
This causes a lot of trouble with the AI constantly calculating impossible paths.

![bla](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3408846/efc4fd1c-fdd0-11e3-9992-4b6c10840492.png)

We ship at least one map https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/ra/maps/poland-raid-v3.oramap that shows this severe problem.

data.title: Disabling shroud breaks select all actors hotkey
data.body: `CTRL` + `A` will just deselect everything when using the shroud removal developer cheat.

data.title: Removed the tank paradrop icon
data.body: This file is unused and there is no consensus that this aids game balancing. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5737

data.title: Cache tileset lookup in Map
data.body:
The lookup accounts for ~50-60% of the time spent in GetTerrainIndex and GetTerrainInfo, and these methods themselves can account for up to 1.3% of total CPU used (during a replay, so admittedly this would be higher than otherwise since there's not as much other work going on during replays). Overall this is a small but measurable win.

This is slightly dangerous since Tileset is a mutable public field but it's used by FieldLoader so I can't safely wrap this up in a property or anything.

data.title: Not detecting content.
data.body:
I install Red Alert using my First Decade Disc and place the Folder in OpenRA>Support>Content>ra 

In game is shows "Install Required" .

data.title: Some fixes at TS
data.body:
1) Harvesters can collect tiberium now. But the game crushes when they back into refinery. I didn't solve it.

2) Harvesters now don't spawn "in" a refinery. They spawn at out of refinery.

3) I add hotkeys to vehicles, infantries and buildings.
